slides.body_text: The River’s Edge Speaks Of The Crossing
slides.name: The River_s Edge Speaks Of The Crossing

slides.body_text: It was the harvest season, and the Jordan was overflowing its banks. But as soon as the feet of the priests who were carrying the Ark touched the water at the river’s edge,
slides.name: Joshua 3 15 NLT

slides.body_text: So the men did as Joshua had commanded them. They took twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan River, one for each tribe, just as the Lord had told Joshua. They carried them to the place where they camped for the night and constructed the memorial there.
slides.name: Joshua 4 8 NLT

slides.body_text: Joshua also set up another pile of twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, at the place where the priests who carried the Ark of the Covenant were standing. And they are there to this day.
slides.name: Joshua 4 9 NLT

slides.body_text: For you are about to cross the Jordan River to take over the land the Lord your God is giving you. When you take that land and are living in it,
slides.name: Deuteronomy 11 31 NLT

slides.body_text: But you will soon cross the Jordan River and live in the land the Lord your God is giving you. When he gives you rest from all your enemies and you’re living safely in the land,
slides.name: Deuteronomy 12 10 NLT

slides.body_text: When you cross the Jordan River and enter the land the Lord your God is giving you, set up some large stones and coat them with plaster.
slides.name: Deuteronomy 27 2 NLT

slides.body_text: Write this whole body of instruction on them when you cross the river to enter the land the Lord your God is giving you—a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the Lord, the God of your ancestors, promised you.
slides.name: Deuteronomy 27 3 NLT

slides.body_text: The Battles Will Continue But So Does Your Covering
slides.name: The Battles Will Continue But So Does Your

slides.body_text: A final word: Be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power.
slides.name: Ephesians 6 10 NLT

slides.body_text: Put on all of God’s armor so that you will be able to stand firm against all strategies of the devil.
slides.name: Ephesians 6 11 NLT

slides.body_text: God Is Ready To Do it Again Every Time You Need It
slides.name: God Is Ready To Do it Again Every Time You Need It

slides.body_text: Then Joshua said to the Israelites, “In the future your children will ask, ‘What do these stones mean?’
slides.name: Joshua 4 21 NLT

slides.body_text: Then you can tell them, ‘This is where the Israelites crossed the Jordan on dry ground.’
slides.name: Joshua 4 22 NLT

slides.body_text: For the Lord your God dried up the river right before your eyes, and he kept it dry until you were all across, just as he did at the Red Sea when he dried it up until we had all crossed over.
slides.name: Joshua 4 23 NLT

slides.body_text: He did this so all the nations of the earth might know that the Lord’s hand is powerful, and so you might fear the Lord your God forever.”
slides.name: Joshua 4 24 NLT
